attributes.comment:
It is my opinion that the proposed fee increases will be present an insurmountable
obstacle to many who want to become naturalized. Immigrants and refugees
work hard and struggle to take care of their families and get an education. If the
fees for permanent residency and citizenship are raised as proposed, a large
number of potential citizens will be lost due to their inability to pay. I understand
that the Office of Citizenship must be self-supporting which is the reason behind
the proposed increases. With the numbers of immigrants and refugees increasing
each year, this method of paying for services is unacceptable. The strength and
diversity of our country has come from an immigrant population and, given the
opportunity through a fair, equitable and reasonable process, this trend will
continue. If fees are increased as proposed, immigrants and refugees will be
forced to decide between caring for their families or fulfilling their dream of
becoming citizens of this great country.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Lynda W. Campbell, Clackamas Community College
